data.title: Blues unveil 2023-24 promotions and theme nights
data.meta_description: RELATED LINKS: Promotions Schedule | Theme Nights
data.text:
Fans will be able to secure their seats for promotional games beginning Friday, Aug. 18 when all single-game tickets for the 2023-24 regular season go on sale at 10 a.m. at stlouisblues.com and ticketmaster.com.

Fans can gain access to an exclusive presale beginning this Thursday at 10 a.m. by visiting stlouisblues.com/subscribe and registering to receive Blues Note-Worthy Offer emails. The deadline to sign up and take advantage of the presale is Wednesday at 11:59 p.m.CT. Right now, fans can purchase a full or half-season ticket plan or one of three 13-game mini-plan options at stlouisblues.com/tickets. Blues ticket plans include a host of great benefits, including flexible payment options, merchandise discounts and the aforementioned access to the single-game ticket presale.

The Blues will introduce several new theme nights for the 2023-24 season, and as in years past, fans that purchase theme-night tickets will receive a unique specialty item connected with the theme. Exciting new offerings include Golf Night presented by Ascension Charity Classic on Oct. 19, featuring a Robert Thomas golfing bobblehead; Dink at the Rink Pickleball Night on Nov. 14, featuring a Blues pickleball jersey; and Racing Fans Night on March 19, featuring a Louie racing bobblehead.

In addition, the Blues will continue to host familiar themes that support community causes, including Hockey Fights Cancer (HFC) presented by Siteman Cancer Center on Dec.12, featuring a lavender Blues HFC fleece blanket; Pink at the Rink presented by Siteman Cancer Center on Jan. 11, featuring Blues pink plaid pajama pants; and First Responders Night on Jan. 28, featuring a Blues duffle bag. For a full list of current theme nights and associated specialty items and to purchase theme-night tickets, click here.

The Blues' giveaway schedule includes must-haves for Blues fans such as the 2023-24 Wall Calendar (all fans) presented by Dobbs Tire & Auto Centers for the home opener on Oct. 14; a Jordan Binnington 2019 Champs Parade bobblehead presented by Pepsi Zero Sugar (first 12,000 fans) on Dec. 14; a 2024 Blues Hall of Fame commemorative banner presented by First Community (first 12,000 fans) on Jan. 20; and a Build-a-Bear (first 3,000 kids 15 and under) on April 14. The remainder of the 2023-24 giveaway schedule can be found by clicking here.

In addition to the Blues' great theme night and giveaway schedules, the team will continue to offer great ways to save on tickets including the Blues Great Saves program and Student Rush. Blues Great Saves, presented by Ticketmaster, allows fans to receive news, special offers and exclusive promotions via text directly from the Blues, while Student Rush delivers special ticket offers just for students. For more information on these programs, fans should visit stlouisblues.com/tickets.
